reference.shortdesc: The equation-figure element represents an equation that functions as a form of figure or display.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Display equations can have titles, descriptions, figure groups, and all other figure components. The direct children of equation-figure can be the equation content itself (for example, mathml or an image reference), or it can be one or more equation-block elements, along with other elements allowed within figures.
When an equation-figure element has multiple direct child mathml, image, or pre elements, each child represents an alternative form of the equation.

When the intent is to have equations combined with other commentary within an equation-figure, the recommended best practice is to use child equation-block elements to contain the equations and clearly distinguish them from the commentary.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Display equations are intended to be numbered when numbering is desired.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: Processors are free to choose the form or forms that they use in deliverables. For example, if there is both an image and MathML markup, an HTML-generating processor could generate both the image reference and the MathML with appropriate HTML class or id values to enable dynamic rendering based on browser capability. All other direct-child elements of equation-figure are treated normally.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The equation-figure element is specialized from fig. It is defined in the equation domain module.
